source.9bf837dd:
# Increase the size of the heatmap.
plt.figure(figsize=(16, 6))
# Store heatmap object in a variable to easily access it when you want to include more features (such as title).
# Set the range of values to be displayed on the colormap from -1 to 1, and set the annotation to True to display the correlation values on the heatmap.
heatmap = sns.heatmap(df.corr(), vmin=-1, vmax=1, annot=True)
# Give a title to the heatmap. Pad defines the distance of the title from the top of the heatmap.
heatmap.set_title('Correlation Heatmap', fontdict={'fontsize':12}, pad=12);
source.ab6930b0:
####This analysis shows the sales trend and productivity by branches in relation to product,gross income,product line,payment method etc...The analysis shows that some product line have more sales in certain branches.
#### Branch A Female to Male is 52.647% to 47.353 % with Member to Normal customer 50.882% to 49.118% respectively
#####Branch B Female to Male is 51.205% to 48.795% with Member to Normal Customer 50.301% to 49.699%  respectively
#####Branch C Female to Male is 54.268% to 45.732% with Member to Normal Customer 51.524% to 48.476%  respectively

####Branch Output

###Branch A had a total income of 5057.1605 with total quantity sold 1859,with the highest sales coming from home and lifestyle product,most used payment method E wallet,credit card and cash
###Branch B had a total income of 5057.032  with total quantity sold 1820 the highest sales coming from fashion accessories and sports and travelling,most used payment E wallet, credit card and cash
###Branch C had a total income of 5265.1765 with total quantity sold 1831 the highest sales from food and beverages and fashion accessories,most used payment E wallet,credit card and cash

#### The analysis also show a strong relationship between unit price,gross income ,tax as shown in the abpve heat map.
